alert.note: Alert for Cabarrus (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 09 at 5:55AM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding will occur as a result of heavy rainfall overnight. * WHERE...A portion of southern Cabarrus County, North Carolina. * WHEN...Until 900 AM EST. * IMPACTS...River or stream flows are elevated and minor flooding is expected, mainly in low-lying areas and along tributaries of the Rocky River. Flooding along Back Creek south of Harrisburg may occur near the intersection of Robinson Church Road and Stallings Road, which is near Middleton and Rocky Meadows subdivisions. Pharr Mill Road may eventually be submerged. A Flood Warning could be needed at some point this morning. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 555 AM EST, gauge reports indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain fell overnight, and additional showers are possible this morning. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Downtown Concord, West Concord, Harrisburg and Mt Pleasant. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: When it is safe to do so, please report flooding or landslides threatening roads or property to the National Weather Service Greenville-Spartanburg by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, by posting on our Facebook page, or via Twitter using hashtag NWSGSP. Your message should describe the specific location where impacts occurred and the depth of flooding observed.
